Reviews.Title: Security Issues
Reviews.Author: PC
Reviews.Content: No way to secure the camera video/images. Only the main page is authenticated. The mobile page is NOT secured/authenticated.Camera exposes your wifi security key in plain text.Camera exposes your youtube username and password in plain text.If this camera is hooked up to the internet then anyone that knows where to look can access your security settings, change any setting on the camera, view your camera, and control your camera.There are other issues with this camera but given the above issues they are not even relevant.Incase anyone is interested about what runs this camera:Operating System is Linux (or some Unix variant)Streams using VLC Media Player ([...])Web Server is thttpd ([...])

Reviews.Title: Works Pretty Good For Me
Reviews.Author: Mark C. Giovannetti
Reviews.Content: IntroductionI purchased the Astak Mole camera to try one out; it is my first IP camera ever, so keep that in mind.  After performing a lot of research on IP cameras, I realized the main issues with them were dropping of wireless connections and night vision performance.  I am only using a wired ethernet connection, but the night vision performance is somewhat important; the camera is intended for use in my children's bedrooms at night.Before I found the Mole at a warehouse club with a great return policy, the top candidate for use in the kid's rooms was the Foscam FI8908W (aka cam0011), since the night vision performance was listed as 0.5 Lux.  The Foscam is much cheaper than this unit, but it was a no-brainer for me to try out the mole, given the no-hassle return policy.Camera SetupI did not use the YOICS service or the setup CD.  I am fairly tech-oriented, but also found some instructions on the internet and a youtube video on how to set it up manually, which gave me a confidence boost!  Basically, you plug in the camera to your network and locate the IP address assigned by the DHCP server.  Next, you log in directly to the camera's web page for setup.  I am only using wired, not wireless.Night VisionI have noticed upon researching the mole camera (after purchase), that the Lux specifications for the night vision are not listed anywhere that I could find.  My testing thus far (in a completely darkened kitchen) reveals pretty good night vision performance at up to ten feet away.  I did not test further than that, as the kids' rooms are not that big, but want to try it outside also, by setting it near a window.Audio PerformanceThe audio performance seemed good to me when testing in our kitchen.  This is an important attribute for me, given the intended use.Motion DetectionThe built-in motion detection seems to be really sensitive, but I did not try playing with the default settings.  Motion detection is not too important for me, so I did not invest a lot of time in trying to improve it from the default settings.Browser PerformanceI tested out the camera's web interface on Internet Explorer 7 (Windows XP) via a wireless (N) laptop and a wired desktop.  I also tested it out on Safari (Snow Leopard) via an iMac with a wired gigabit connection.  Interestingly, Safari did not perform as well when viewing the camera live feed; the audio/video was delayed and the camera's response to commands (pan/tilt) was slow.  IE7 worked much better in this regard.  It did seem to freeze when left on overnight (requiring a page refresh), but I only think this happened on IE when using the wireless laptop.ConclusionOverall, I think this is a pretty nice camera (for my first IP camera), and think I will keep it; I can return it at any time.  I will do some more testing before trying it out in the kid's rooms at night.  The IE freezing issue may a problem, but that may be an issue with my wireless laptop.  My monitoring plan for multiple moles is (eventually) to utilize DVR software, so it remains to be seen how the mole will work with the DVR software I purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly Easy to Set Up and Use
Reviews.Author: Adoptive Dad
Reviews.Content: This camera is a winner.  Unboxed it, followed the quick start guide (hook up the network cable BEFORE the power cord) and installed software for initial setup.  Worked perfectly, created user site and then stepped us through the wireless setup too, if desired.  Unplug the network cable and the power cable, move camera to where you want it and plug in the power again.  Tell the setup software to find the camera and that is it!  Works beautifully with amazing video and connection speed.  You can hook up a set of speakers to it and turn on the microphone that is built in for 2 way conversations (if desired) to the area you are monitoring.  Pan and tilt worked great and with user defined HOME setting that brings the camera back to center on what ever area is most important to you.  This camera really works great and watches the entire livingroom / dining area easily.  The infrared works surprisingly well since I have had other infrared illuminated cameras with so-so results.  Shop around for the price before buying.  Great system.  Highly recommended.  It will be great to watch the house when I want to from out of state when needed.

Reviews.Title: Has never missed a beat.  Real value for my money.
Reviews.Author: edward VI
Reviews.Content: We purchased our Astak Wireless Camera to monitor our home from overseas, where we spend 3 months at a time twice a year.  It only took minutes to set up and I can access it from any computer in the world.  It also sends me regular shots at prescribed intervals via email as well as anytime any motion is detected.  Has operated flawlessly since we bought it.  Unbelievable performance for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not easy for novices, but still it works well
Reviews.Author: Cranky
Reviews.Content: My install took a little longer than typical, because I wasn't going to open my network or install software just to use the camera.  [A lot of time was spent figuring out what MAC address to allow onto my WiFi router.  The WiFi MAC address not the LAN MAC address.  Duh.]  Also, I configured it at home with one network and moved it on-site into a different network.The diagnostics could be more detailed, to allow for debugging.  All of my difficulties were in setting up the e-mail feed and the FTP feed, but that is not really the camera's fault.  More diagnostics would have made it easier.If I have any complaints, it would be that the camera does not have a setting to turn off all of the LED indicators on the camera.  That makes it hard to install an unobtrusive camera if it flickers whenever it senses motion.  Fortunately, by the time some vandal sees the camera and grabs it, the images will have been safely uploaded.  We'll see how errant animals react to the camera.  I don't think they'll care about the LEDs.  Raccoons can be sneaky though - I worry that they'll cut the battery power to the WiFi router before breaking in.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera that I purchased.  I use them in the house to keep an eye on my elderly mother while I am not there.  She has caregivers while we are at work and it allows me to watch her and make sure that she is being given the proper care. I can watch from work on my PC or anywhere with my iPhone.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: great machine
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Mayer "Da Michi"
Reviews.Content: Very reliable, easy to set up and configure. Can also be used as stand-alone unit to record pictures or footage, when detecting movement in a designated area. Great support from all different sources.

Reviews.Title: Mole Review
Reviews.Author: Richard Sutherland
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product at Costco a year or so ago for my business. I own a tattoo shop and I'm not always able to be there. The Mole allows me to check up on the shop, who's there and I can see and hear what's going on when I'm not there. It's been a good way for me to keep in touch with my staff while I'm out of town because the camera can be viewed and operated via the web from wherever I'm at. I can speak over the camera, move the camera hear and record anything at any time. Very useful product I would recommend The Mole to any business or homeowner that wants a little added security at their business or home.Rick S.

Reviews.Title: It Simply Works
Reviews.Author: Michael R O Rear
Reviews.Content: What a product.  It set up simply, works as advertised and has been trouble free.  Our camera is at our cottage and serves two purposes.  First it lets us get a quick peak at the view of the lake -- not as good as being there but refreshing none the less.  Second, it provides confirmation that all is well -- we pan the camera around the great room including a peak at the weather station display that shows inside and outside temps.We are thinking of getting a second camera for a second location at the cottage, it is that cool.

Reviews.Title: Kitty Cam
Reviews.Author: J Silberman
Reviews.Content: this is an awesome product. I use it to check on my Cats. I can be in the next room or on the other side of the planet to view them day or night. Whilst the picture quality isnt the best I have no complaints, I would highly recommend this product to any potential buyer.

Reviews.Title: Best IP cam.
Reviews.Author: Mrinal
Reviews.Content: I got this as a baby monitor...so it can work on my phone tv computer and on my ipad.Love it so much got another one for my new baby now i have 2 of them.

Reviews.Title: Great Camrea
Reviews.Author: KLM
Reviews.Content: Works well in low light, great PTZ features, remote access portal.  Easy installation and set up. Will buy another soon.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Camera works great on a job site to keep tabs on employees. The iPhone and android apps are easy and work well. Have caught two employees sleeping on the job already. Have it paired up with a  Clear Wire modem and it works great on a 4g signal. Planning to buy more soon!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic device!
Reviews.Author: aiki
Reviews.Content: I bought this to keep an eye on things while not at home. It's a great device, easy to set up and get going. There is an iPhone and iPad App that really works. Remotely, one can change the direction of the camera. It's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Dog Cam
Reviews.Author: Beantownsox
Reviews.Content: We use this camera to keep an eye on the dogs while we are not home. Easy setup, good day time picture, amazing night time / low light picture, and the pan and tilt feature is awesome. Friends and family are very impressed being able to watch over the house on my iPhone.  App is a couple of bucks but worth it.

Reviews.Title: Works well as an indoor camera.
Reviews.Author: Andy "Andy"
Reviews.Content: A warehouse club had this at a great price, so I took a chance, and I'm glad I did. The camera detection software won't pick up the camera, but I am able to view it and control it by entering the IP address in my browser. It works great in Internet Explorer 9 on one of my computers, but it won't connect on the other. However, I was able to get it up in Firefox after tweaking the Quicktime settings as explained in the camera setup guide. Setting up the wireless connection was a snap (after I realized I needed to attach the antenna!). Night vision works well indoors, but doesn't really work through a window if you want to see outdoors at night. The microphone is very sensitive, so it's easy to hear what's going on. Pan/tilt via the browser controls is pretty slow and laggy. However, there are buttons to continuously scan left/right and up/down. Also, you can press the Home button to return to center or the Call button to go to another position you have selected. I haven't tried the e-mail alerts or YouTube uploads yet, but I'll probably just try to get the camera on a static IP address so I can view directly on my smart phone. Tech support was easy to contact via chat, and a technician helped me with a few setup questions I had. Overall, I really like this camera, and you can't beat the features for the price.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up
Reviews.Author: James Cioffi
Reviews.Content: Set up easily though software somewhat difficult to understand.  I have not been able to get the two way audio to work.  I can hear what is going on but cannot talk through the mole yet.  Otherwise nicely constructed and preforms as advertised, visible easily on iphone, etc.

Reviews.Title: Product Review of Astak Wireless Mole IP Camera
Reviews.Author: MassFlowRate
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Mole wireless IP camera so that I would be able to monitor my apartment while away on vacation.  I have owned my Mole for 18 months and so far I can honestly say it has been a good choice for my needs.  The camera connects to my internet connection through my wireless router, and that made installation a snap with no wires to run... just place the camera near a power plug.  The Mole software allows me to access the camera using any PC.  I am also able to view or operate it from my Android phone although there is not an Android specific application yet written for it.  The user has the ability to set up motion sensing and can define specific areas of the screen with a "box".  Any movement within the defined area will trigger the camera to start recording, and send a message to my phone with a picture of what it saw.  Further, the Mole will send the video it records to your Youtube account if you desire.  I love that feature!  I simply set up a private youtube account and send all video there, when I am not at home, the camera warns me of anything it sees and after looking at the attached photo, I can go to youtube from my smartphone and view the video.  On several instances I was able to not only keep an eye on my apartment complex's maintenance personnel while they worked inside my apartment, but was able to listen in on their conversation as well.If you are looking for a simple solution to monitor a home or office I think the Mole is a good choice for the price...  It offers a simple setup, adequate tools to monitor and alert the user of any motion it sees, and video is immediately stored off sight to the internet making it impossible for anyone to tamper with. I also allows the user the ability to control the camera and listen in on your smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Great product but the price is steep!
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: This is a great looking camera and performs great but for the price I paid I expected a little more. Still satisfied tho!

Reviews.Title: Bring it back to costco
Reviews.Author: Yepacino
Reviews.Content: User friendly. Very easy to setup. Good resolution. Found our missing dog thanks to this awesome ip camera. The only thing is make it optimize for osx. Overall we are satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Best home security camera by MOLE
Reviews.Author: Peter Sipos
Reviews.Content: I bought this MOLE camera last year, so that I can watch what my little poodle Sammy is doing at home while we are out for a few hours. The way I can control the unit using my iPhone4 is simply amazing! My evening outings became much more relaxed and more fun since we have this amazing little piece of technology! Some of my friends saw it in operation and they all went to buy one. Now we are all very happy!

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased The Astak wireless mole from Costco last fall to keep an eye on our backyard while we were "snow birding" in Arizona for the winter.  It worked better than I had expected!  While we were away I was able to detect several problems with the pool and the fence that could have become serious.  But since we detected them early with the mole we had them fixed before they got worse.  The Yoics.com site was good.  Every day the mole emailed me a picture of the back yard. I even did a presentation to my computer club about the Astak Mole.  It was very well received.

Reviews.Title: Great but better if Safari enabled
Reviews.Author: Van Fan
Reviews.Content: This little camera does the job.  Able to remotely move around, change parameters, etc.  The only drawback is that it has limited functionality for Macs - can't set multiple motion windows, can't listen in the room or do any of the sound stuff, etc.  sometimes hard to connect to while on the road, but with the ability to post onto YouTube, can still see what's happening in the homestead.  Sometimes it doesn't always catch the action, but still useful.

Reviews.Title: Mole wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Suho
Reviews.Content: I tried numerous security cameras in the past, wired and wireless types, but being digital and web based, this one gives me the most satisfaction. The picture quality is good, the setup and configuration is nicely flexible and the idea of being able to record both still and video pictures is a good option. Unfortunately, the SD card failed and now I cannot recover it's content. I'm looking forward to purchase a second camera.

Reviews.Title: A Great Security Device
Reviews.Author: Walleye Banana
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for monitoring my home while I'm away.  I am able to remotely point the camera at either the front or side door and verify that all is secure.  The low light capabilities allow me to check at any time, night or day.  Because it's a wireless device I am able to move it to any place in the house without worry about connecting to an Ethernet connection.  The image that it sends is surprisingly clear with good detail.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with it..
Reviews.Author: Elchin
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a new Astak Mole Wireless IP camera a week ago from Amazon. This is my first camera. At the beginning, I experienced a number of problems. First, after the installation of the Mole IP Setup from the CD, the running program says that as a first step I should register my Mole camera. All my attempts to register it through this program failed. It says it can not find unregistered cameras. Anyway, I did the registration from astac.yoics.com. I also upgraded to the Yoics Pro.Second problem is that the camera behaves strangely after 2-3 minutes of operation. It start rotating probably in serach of wi-fi, then freezes with face turned back, and that's it. It is the same when connected through both LAN and wifi. The only way to revive it is reboot. After the reboot it works again 2-3 minutes and freezes again. It is really annoying.Third, and the most irritating problem - I plug it in, it starts working ok, wifi connected. I come to my office, open yoics, open my camera. It works ok. Then I log out, and that is it. I can no longer connect to my camera, unless I call home and ask someone to reboot it. I can't even see my camera in yoics website under My Stuff. Gone, as if never existed.I tried to reach out to Astak, posted on its Facebook page. My post disappeared.I am thinking of retuirning it back.

Reviews.Title: Had my Astak Mole for almost a year now, great product!
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Sicotte
Reviews.Content: I've had my Astak Mole IP camera for almost a year now. At first I was using the free Yoics.com account to access my camera when away from home, but now I have my firewall setup so I don't use Yoics anymore.I love this camera. Especially the built-in upload to youtube. I've found this camera to be rugged, easy to configure, and very reliable. I've never had any problems with it at all. I can Pan and Tilt all from my Android smart phone -- I can even access and control the camera from my Android smart phone.You can set this camera up to detect pixel changes within a field of view, once it detects movement it will start recording the footage and auto-upload it to youtube, or you can auto-upload it to an FTP server, and it's also saved on the internal SD memory card.You can also configure this camera to email you when motion is detected, with a .jpg image attached to the email!The night vision is pretty good too.Over all this camera is a good choice for an entry-level IP PTZ camera, very feature rich, it works, it's easy to configure, and it's reliable.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera - But No Audio on Anything Except Internet Explorer!
Reviews.Author: Charles Stewart
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use as a baby monitor, mostly on our Droid X Android phones.  I installed using the IP address assigned to it by the router, as I didn't want to install their software.  Installation was fairly easy, aside from the unit not finding any wireless networks (I had to enter the info manaullyl).  At first, I really liked the camera after using it in Internet Explorer (as recommended), but was disappointed that the audio didn't work in Firefox, Chrome, Opera, etc.  The deal-breaker, however, was that we are not able to get any audio on our Droids, making it nearly useless as a baby monitor.  I even tried installing IP Cam Viewer Pro, which operated it beautifully and has a much better interface than the browser, but again, no sound.The box and display at Costco gave no indication of it's limitations, even touting it's ability to work on Android, iPhone, etc.  That is misleading and false advertising.  With proper support, this could be a really nice little camera, but until it plays nice with other browsers and software, Astak is going to be getting a lot of these units returned.

Reviews.Title: I love the Mole!
Reviews.Author: Barry A. Gray "bagray112"
Reviews.Content: Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (Black)This does everything it promises and more. Bought mine from Costco. Easy to use and network. Awesome sight. Also you get audio depending on the broser you use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the cost
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews on this camera and I would disagree on the bad feedback. If you know anything about IP wireless camera, you can't get the features at this price point (I got my from Costco). I've own many IP wireless/wire cameras and all of them have costed over $250 per unit. You need to read the instruction on how to setup the camera. It comes with software to locate it's IP address and connect to it. Once you connect to the camera, you can start config the setting to meet your network needs. Support I agree is not very good, but what do you expect from the price. It does make a sound when motion is detected and the light does not turn off.

Reviews.Title: Software requires you to open a security hole on your computer.
Reviews.Author: SurferJeff
Reviews.Content: In order to record video, you need to turn off UAC on your Windows computer.  It actually says that in the FAQ.  Ha.  Nope, I needed to take it back to the store.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: e-effect
Reviews.Content: I am not a security expert, but I wanted some way to monitor my home and in-house dogs while I was away.  I bought my first Mole about over a year ago and could not be happier.  It performs all of the functions I was looking for and more.  I can view my home through my web browser online anywhere with an internet connection.  It has motion sensors with a programmable viewing area that will take snap shots in both photo and video formats with direct upload to an ftp server as well as saving it locally on an internal smart media card that comes installed with the camera.  The snap shot photos also get emailed to me so I can check them on my smart phone while I'm out.One thing I found to be very helpful in installing the product is to reserve the original IP address that the Mole acquires when you connect it to your router wirelessly the first time.  That way Yoics' server can locate it every time you log in to view it and you won't have any connection problems.  In my router, this function is located under the DHCP reservation table.I recently had a commercial security give me a quote on a security system and they said it would be a waste of my time to have them install the cameras since the Moles do everything they could.  I now have 4 and am quite happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: my 3rd one
Reviews.Author: Coopers dad
Reviews.Content: i bought 2 moles a few years ago to monitor my country home.  One looks out on the road entering so i can see anyone, friend or foe, coming up the path.  The other looks out to the lake so when i get "country sick" while  home i just peek in at the lake, watch the waves and relax.  Bought my 3rd camera for my home in the city to check things there.  This one from timetec works just as well but was "half" the price

Reviews.Title: Works great if you can get it installed
Reviews.Author: kgkrost
Reviews.Content: bought one for our home in the midwest.  easy install and has worked like a charm since.  bought one for our home in Arizona and could not get it installed wirelessly.  Tech support for the product is non existent.  Had a different wireless router in Arizona.  Shipped the Arizona camera back to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Frame of mind
Reviews.Author: Zijan
Reviews.Content: The cameras have been reliable, however, I am not so sure about the customer service. I would rate the cameras with five stars, if the maximum potential of the product had been achieved. I consider myself tech-saavy. However, my disappointment may be related to an Apple interface or maybe I was expecting too much. Anyway, buy the product, because it serves as a deterrent in my practice setting, even if the frame capture, motion sensitivity, and E-mail alarms do not function appropriately frame by frame. I may not have been in the right...

Reviews.Title: JUNK - STAY AWAY - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME!
Reviews.Author: Suffered Enough
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible product which I could not get to link to the company's web page with any passwords they provided.  The enclosed CD was worse and failed to wirelessly link the device as advertised.  Customer service is non-existent.  I called during regular business hours and no one answers and their prompt is to leave voice mail, neither call was returned.  Instant chat does not connect either - they say they're not there at the moment.  Stay away from this awful product.  It does not work as advertised. It is a waste of time trying to set up and a waste of money.  I promptly returned the camera for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Beer Man
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Astak Mole for the last year and haven't had any problems with it.  I use it as a security camera and upload motion triggered clips to youtube. I leave it on 24/7 and I've never had a time when it stopped working.  The yoics website makes a handy way to remotely monitor the camera.  Its nice to be able to pan around the room to check on things.  The web interface is not very quick to respond, but this could be a result of the slow network connect at work. All in all, I would recommend this camera for anyone wanting an easy way to remotely monitor a room in their house or business.Cons: It would be nice to have a dedicated Android app.  The yoics web interface has a limited daily connection time for free users.  I have never needed to monitor longer and the full access is pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: Miserable
Reviews.Author: The Den
Reviews.Content: Absolutely terrible... Plugged it in, and it showed up as registered already, so we couldn't register it.  And guess what?  You MUST register it for it to work.  Clicked on the link for the "24/7" customer support... guess what?  It was closed for the holidays... How is that 24/7?Sent a message to support.  Never heard back.Now a week later, tried again and finally got their support.  A clearly east Indian guy named "Paul" (right) stepped me through rebooting the camera over and over and any number of factory resets.  Got the camera visible from my computer, but even with him doing manual overrides from there, they couldn't get it to register (giving him the Mac address showed that someone else with an AOL email address had already registered the camera... how is this possible for a NIB product from Costco?  Bizarre repackaging perhaps?  Company selling used garbage that didn't work in the first place?  very suspicious).So, all told, a lot of time and energy trying to get this junk to work, but their own website and registration requirements crippled the thing.Meanwhile, once I got my computer registered with their "yost" system, guess what DID show up?  Not the MOLE camera I bought for a ton of money... but my own Logitech computer cam.  Weird... now why don't I have to "register" that and provide it's Mac address?  You morons are crippling your own product with this stuff!Returning to costco.  Good riddance.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY IT
Reviews.Author: N0M@nSL@nd
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that some peeople rated this crappy camera more than 1 star. In addition to all the cofiguration issues that lot of people ha run to, the camera has several security and opeartional issues.1)The camera keeps making a clicking noise every once in a while2)As noted in previous comments, only the main page is authenticated3)if you decide to chat with their MCPs "Microsoft Certified professional: this is by the way, one of the lowest certification in the technical field and MCPs are mainly hired as entry level techs", they will ask you to click on a link then they will remote, access and take control of your computer, without your pre-approval or authorization, I found this really disturbing WTF, have these guys heard of PRIVACY before !!!!! Well, when I called to complain, KIM sounded like if he is from India, so that tells it all..4)The WIFI SSID and authentication information are transmitted in clear plain text5)SD card can't be managed from the camera, you can view/play the images/recording but you can't rename or delete them.6) The camera has a green led that stays on all the time. Denny, the customer support MCP, asked me to be creative and cover it with a black tape..WTF7)I always keep #7 for funny things; the camera will stop recording if any of this applies  a) You close your browser (regardles which one)  b) You browse from another system (good thing about it is that this "feature" doesn't descriminate..this will happen  regardless if you are a MAC, PC, Windows, Linux, Asian, Floridian or Red Sox fan)  c) if you use your smart phone (no descrimination in which brand you are using either :~) ) The only way for the camera to keep recording is to keep your browser open and not remote from any other computer or smartphoneA Dummy Camera will do a better jon than the ASTAK products, so DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA, and if you did TAKE IT BACK, COSTCO gives you 90 days to return electronics with a FULL refund..

Reviews.Title: Wireless connection keep failing
Reviews.Author: Y. han "njmk"
Reviews.Content: I bought one from costco. Spend little bit time with vendor support. Made wireless connection worked just for one and half day. Then after I powered the camera off then wireless stop working. No matter what I do I cannot make wireless connection work. It works with wired connection. I am returning it tomorrow. Support is good and helpful. and product feature are also good. Just wireless connection is sucks. Do not buy it.mk

Reviews.Title: Useless
Reviews.Author: technoid
Reviews.Content: Device failed to connect to wireless. After hours of troubleshooting it is going back into the box and back to the retailer.Also, I agree with the above security issues. Too risky. How would you like someone peering into your living room without your knowledge.

Reviews.Title: Junk.....and poor tech support
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these IP cameras a few months ago and set them up at my summer home.The wireless range is very short and only works sometimes.I have tried repeatedly to contact Yoics.com for tech support....registered on their site...etc.Nothing.....not even a "drop dead" response.I called Mole tech support.  Sounded like a woman operaing out of her home.All she could say was unplug the camera and start over.I explained that the camera was 2400 miles from me and that it would "paint" part of a screensometimes and that it was trying to work.She just wanted to end the call.....She was rude and abrupt.She said if you can't see the image....reset the camera.I keep saying ....it works some times and it's the software that is at fault....I can log into the local computer at the summer home site and pull up the camera using the local IP address and itworks every time.  So I know the camera is working....she would hear none of this....her only line wasunplug the camera and then see if it works.Not the problem at all.Almost the worst customer service I have every experienced....only AT&T; is worse.Find another IP camera supplier.This one sucks.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to operate
Reviews.Author: Q. Wang "Q.Q."
Reviews.Content: Although the ASTAK camera is one of the better ones I've tried -- these things are notoriously poorly designed, in my opinion -- I've had this thing running uninterruptedly for 23 months now.PASSWORD SETUPOn a wireless network, one is supposed to change the access password every so often.  After about two years, I decided to do that to my home network (Apple).But then the camera's network didn't work any more.  I clicked about a lot on ASTAK's screens and nothing happened. I followed the procedure on the setup screen, which I eventually found -- it requires you to find an old network cable from your junk-cable box, and use that.  Of course the first 2 cables I tried didn't work, so I was quite frustrated. (I think some of these cables, although they are alike on the outside aren't guaranteed to be the same as the cable needed here).  Be that as it may, I tried a third cable that worked and the setup proceeded after that. After giving my new password to the prompt in the stup, all was fine.NB:  To get my WiFi iMac, iPad, etc. to work, I didn't need a cable... All I needed was my new password :)MEMORY CARD and FRI CTIONWhile I'm at it and have the Mole Cam down from its perch, I'd like to swap out the SD card to put a higher capacity one into the camera.  Nowhere on the card slot is it specified what the maximum memory capacity is that this thing will take before puking.  WHY?  Why not?  Do the gentleman at ASTAK want me to go rummaging through my things ftom two years ago to find what its specs are?  The lettering on the back of the camera is, of course, printed in tiny letters, black on black.  Thank you, Astak!  Why designers and programmers and their managers insist on such causing FRICTION in the use of a product is beyond me!  Take a lesson from the likes of Apple and THINK before you kick your product over the fence to the sales department!SOUNDAnother irritating thing about this setup is that there is no VOLUME control.  Sure, I can use the computer's control to diminish the echo from the cam, but this s/b a native feature.FUTURE PURCHASEWhen I initially set this thing up I found many more frustrating things about the ASATK cam, but it's been two years now and I don't remember everything -- but I remember that!  :(. And I'll remember THAT if I'm ever in the position to consider an ASTAK product for purchase.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE!!!  Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: Business Man "Business Man"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product at Costco.  Figured if Costco carried it that it must be good.  It is horrible!The "EZ" install was difficult at best.  The customer service rep wanted to remotely access my computer.The iphone app didn't work.  The up and down; left to right adjustment on the camera didn't work.  Audio didn't work.  Just a complete waste of time.  Now I have to return to Costco.

Reviews.Title: CRAP CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Robelek
Reviews.Content: Wow,What an unbelievably crappy camera. I will NEVER buy any products from "Astak" again!! It looks like it was made in China. The quality is very low, it makes this very loud click when just plain operating, the software is the most poorly written I have seen and the page registration keeps stating "we found a new camera" EVERYTIME I LOGIN. No kidding Astac.PLEASE, I BEG YOU ALL, SAVE YOUR MONEY AND BUY A DIFFERENT CAMERA. THIS CAMERA IS HORRIBLE AND LUCKILY I SAVED THE RECEIPT CAUSE THIS IS GOING BACK TO THE REFURBISHED DEPARTMENT. And no, I am not going to call for support first because your product is garbage.What would I recommend. Panasonic wireless cameras or those from Toshiba. You will pay a little more but you will get your money's worth. Trust me! If you pay about $75 more than this camera (about $270) you will get a quality camera from Panasonic. You can pay $1000 if you want and get a really amazing wireless camera that you can view on your mobile phone. Amazing.Astak. Huh! Time for a drink after this one. Maybe I can build a Lego camera and make it better. Yup, it's that easy.Oh, and I'd love to submit a video review with my Astac camera . .  but you can guess what happened to that.

ProductInfo.Features:
Installation CD available, simple setup with no network configuration required
View and control from any computer, iPhone, iPad, Android smart phone and tablet
Remote pan (270 degrees) and tilt (125 degrees) control
Built in IR to ensure high quality image for day and night time
On board smart motion trigger DVR for events recording
ProductInfo.Name: Astak Mole Pan/Tilt IP/Network/Wireless Camera with Night Vision, Motion Detection, Built-In DVR and Trigger Email Notifications. Apple/Mac/Andriod/Windows compatible
